ARCANE

AnticipatoRy Complex Adaptive Network Extrapolation (ARCANE)

Download .zip Download .tar.gz View on GitHub

Introduction

ARCANE is a genetic algorithm system for automatically generating system dynamics models that differ in both their embedded parameters and their fundamental equations while maintaining dimensional consistency. It is intended to be used for anticipatory modeling of systems such as complex networks.

API documentation can be found here.

Author

ARCANE was developed by Michael J. North (@drmichaelnorth) at Argonne National Laboratory.

ARCANE is maintained by drmichaelnorth
Tactile theme by Jason Long.
